column1: I was very happy. But when I was eleven years old
column3: and then I couldn't walk. My parents took me to the hospital.I had to stay in hospital for three years. I was very tired and I slept many hours every day. After three years the doctors told me I would not be able to walk again. I was very sad because I love sports.I went to a special school in Umtata
column4: and my teachers encouraged me. It was a very busy school
column5: with lots of activities like sport and sewing. On weekends we had tasks to do. We had to clean our rooms
column6: polish our shoes and clean our wheelchairs. I decided to keep trying
column7: and never give up. If you have a disability
column8: you can still do something you love. I love to see how far I can go
column9: so I entered a competition. I won a bronze medal for shot putt
column10: a silver medal for discus and a gold medal for javelin.
